intro: Geniosporum siamense, commonly known as the Siam spider flower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spider-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a distinctive central cluster of tiny, thread-like petals. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
